briefdescription.para: Contains the Matrix Product State (MPS) for two sites, A and B, corresponding to sites $n$ and $n+1$, respectively.

sect1.title: Description
sect1.para: During the initial infinite-DMRG stage, sites A and B are swapped in each iteration to mimic the movement between even and odd positions in a translationally invariant chain.

sect2.title: Background
sect2.para: In both the infinite and finite DMRG algorithms, the MPS in this class will be used to construct $\Theta$, a two-site MPS tensor of rank 4:

blockquote.para:
Note that the first $ \Lambda^B_{n-1} $ is special:
During infinite-DMRG $ \Lambda^B_{n-1} = \Lambda^B_{n+1} $ because we expect the MPS to be symmetric about $n$.
During finite-DMRG it is simply the bond directly to the left of $n$.

sect2.title: Diagram
sect2.para:
In diagrammatic tensor notation the two-site MPS is: [d] [d] Theta = [chia]__.__|__.__|__.__[chib]
LB GA LA GB LB where the values in [ ] denote the dimension of each leg of the full tensor:
$d$ = local (or physical) dimension. Default is 2 for spin-1/2, Ising spins or qubits.
$\chi_a$ = Left dimension equivalent to bond dimension of $\Lambda^B_{n-1}$
$\chi_b$ = Right dimension equivalent to bond dimension of $\Lambda^B_{n+1}$
Tensor index order convention: See the Home page.
